text: well we know that there's technology
today that allows you to bend glass and
then by putting a charge through it it
can make the glass stronger it's not
able to actually fold it there's fiber
optics out there that for data
communication as the glass can bend and
so that ideas out there
MIT this spring put out a paper that
talked about bendable glass and the
eventualities that this will be foldable
and companies like Samsung have talked
about having a foldable phone in the
next couple years and so what we know is
that that technology is in the early
stages it's a few years away and we also
know that from a consumer standpoint
this idea of being able to have
something that is the size of a
smartphone and then can fold open to be
the size of a small tablet would be
appealing so there seems to be a market
force behind it so when we put all that
together we think this is a logical
extension of where the phone iPhone can
go
